column4: I was following this thread on installing the latest version of SVN and although everything appears to have gone fine svn --version still comes back as the old version can anyone point out where i might have gone wrong http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=1498857
just glancing at it ..... have you amended PATH to prefer /usr/local?
turd no i had missed that whats that all about then (sorry a little bit of newb)
nw sometimes i stumble on the right tree root
is that something that i can do now or i should have done at install?
i think its somethng he suggests you do without being didactic about it
xerox you have already been told not to use rpm's
right click on the file and choose delete
i cant see where this is supposed to be set is it the line for the berkelydb?
my greatest fear was you would ask that question lol
its just i have personally never fiddled with it
oh good lord what the hell is that
i already have a previous install should really go where ever that is
oohhh just typed svn --version and it has changed to the new version....problem solved wtf..thanks
